title: Peer-Supported Training Program to Strengthen Public Health Literature Search Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic literature search techniques and foundational public health knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners conduct literature search projects on complex public health topics in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, developing practical skills through peer feedback

learning_goals: Learners can design search strategies combining three or more complex topic keywords using specialized public health databases.
Learners provide feedback on the accuracy and relevance of literature search results through peer review and suggest improvements.
Learners can select and summarize five or more core literature pieces applicable to solving real public health issues through project-based tasks.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
